instruction: How does the use of GPU contribute to time-efficient green space identification and monitoring in urban environments?
Output:
The use of GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) contributes to time-efficient green space identification and monitoring in urban environments by accelerating the processing speed of the analysis. GPUs are designed to handle large amounts of data and perform parallel processing, which allows for faster computation and analysis of satellite images and other spatio-temporal data. 

In the context of this study, the researchers utilized GPU technology to enhance the efficiency of green space change detection. By leveraging the computational power of GPUs, the analysis of satellite images and the application of the support vector machine (SVM) classification algorithm were accelerated, enabling quicker identification and monitoring of green spaces.

This time efficiency is crucial in fast-changing urban regions where green space change detection needs to be continuous and rapid. By using GPU technology, the researchers were able to process and analyze large datasets more quickly, facilitating the assessment of green space changes over a 15-year period in the Mumbai metropolitan area.

Overall, the use of GPU technology in this study contributed to time efficiency by speeding up the analysis process, allowing for more timely and accurate identification and monitoring of green spaces in urban environments.
